intro: Armeria plantaginea subsp. segoviensis, commonly known as the Segovia thrift, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
